item.description:
OK, I've a novel idea.... How about a flight to 44N for a quick breakfast this Saturday. Leave at 8:30 a.m. Once there, have a quick meeting, refuel both our bellies and fuel tanks.

Head to the Carmel VOR, aka CMK. thats a heading of 180 for 27 miles from 44N.

from there, we turn right to 077 for 17 miles to the Hudson River.

Fly down with radar services at 1300 feet (shoreline on your right. Circle The Lady, fly north up the river (shoreline on your right).

30 miles down and 30 miles back up.

Back to the 257 radial ( past the Verranzano) to CMK and to 058 heading 1 hour tailwind back to KFIT.

Check or print out your NY Helicopter route chart. Freq are there. We can go over things of there is anyone interested. Wx looks ideal.

 

Just gotta go Saturday morning! Anyone flying? Or, just stop at 44N :-(

I expect the whole trip would take us back to FIT by 1:00.

http://www.germaise.com/interests/aviation_flyinghudson1.htm#charts

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m_JJh7dabIo

 

Charley

group.name: Fitchburg Pilots Association/EAA Chapter 1454 Meetup Site

item.name: How about 44N and then visit The Lady
